results.title: In a fishing port
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Commission, ABC-TV (Australia), Jean Richards and Frank L. Few
results.brief_description:
Shows a few days in the life of a daughter of a Port Franklin flounder fisherman, showing her at school, horse riding in the bush and helping her father in his fishing boat to lay nets and sort, clean and pack the fish.
Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: In a cleaner greener land
results.creator_credit: Granada International Productions and Pauline Shaw
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Facts Are These”.
This film deals with the enormous problems of pollution of the air, the water and the land. All three are dealt with in detail but the pollution of the air is given greater attention in this timely film.

results.title: In a Box
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Robert Verrall and Eliot Noyes
results.brief_description: A short animated film of line drawings suggesting the predicament of people who find themselves boxed in by life. It takes only a few deft strokes of the animator’s pen to show how people’s lives are limited by their own view of things. The box they are in may not fit; it may be uncomfortable in many ways, but they rush back to its familiarity, if not security, even though brief sorties outside may show them a bigger world. (Awards: Columbus; Rome)

results.title: In & out = In and out
results.creator_credit: Spelling Films, Scott Rudin, Frank Oz and Ken Adam
results.brief_description: Howard Brackett (Kevin Kline) is about to come out, big time, on National Television, only he doesn’t know it. School teacher Brackett, along with family and friends are watching the Academy Awards when one of his former students makes a revealing acceptance speech when he wins the award for best actor. He thanks his former teacher, Brackett, as providing the inspiration behind his award winning role as a gay soldier. This is startling news to Howard, his fiancee (Joan Cusack), but seems to explain things to Howard’s students and friends who seem to have found an explanation for Howard’s neat ways and Streisand fascination. Howard is desperate to get married to refute his sexuality but hot on his tail is the national press and in particular is an aggressive television reporter (Tom Selleck), who wants Howard to come out for himself on television. Howard has some thinking to do. Cast includes Debbie Reynolds, Matt Dillon, Wilford Brimley and Bob Newhart.

results.title: In-shore waters
results.creator_credit: RGA Films, Film Australia, Peter Johnson and Rob McAuley
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safer Boating with Ken Warby”.
Outlines some basic navigational and safety rules small craft should be aware of when boating in waters used by commercial shipping. Cast: Alan Doggett, Bob Hicks.

results.title: Imran Khan
results.creator_credit: British Broadcasting Corporation and John E. Bodnar
results.brief_description: Imran Khan, the Tiger of Pakistan, was born into a famous cricketing family and became the most inspirational cricketer of his generation. From his early days at Oxford to his full test career with Pakistan, he has experienced unparralleled success as a genuine all-rounder. His test career, spanning three decades, has seen him develop from a precocious talent to a father-like figure exuding respect and experience. Features highlights of his playing career including his many records and achievements.

results.title: Impunidad
results.creator_credit: Cam Productions, SBS-TV, Film Victoria and Helen Gaynor
results.brief_description: Impunidad, impunity n. “exemption from punishment”. In 1954 a CIA-backed military coup toppled the democratic government in Guatemala allowing full control by the Army over the citizens of Guatemala. During the 1960’s and 1970’s a guerilla movement established itself throughout large areas of the country-side, and in the late 70’s the Army took on a “scorched earth policy” destroying 440 villages, with 100,000 civilians murdered and 45,000 missing. In a land shrouded in silence where 2.1% of the population own 72% of arable land, 86% live in poverty and 1,000,000 are internally displaced, Australian filmmaker, Helen Gaynor, worked undercover to reveal the continuing violence between the armed forces and the indigenous peoples, the terror and corruption which still allows the army to continue acting with impunity. 65% of the 10 million population are indigenous Mayan Indians, and despite 500 years of oppression, many facets of their culture survives. Though fewer in number, the disappearances, torture and massacres are still occurring today. Narrated by Jenny Seedsman In English and Spanish with English subtitles.

results.title: Impudence does not pay
results.creator_credit: Progress Film and Bruno I. Botige
results.brief_description: A black and white silhouette film for children telling the story of a gorilla who steals his hunter’s rifle and helmet, after an exciting episode, and then taunts the other animals, even riding on a lion’s back. Finally they can bear it no longer and toss him from his hammock into the open jaws of a crocodile Music only

results.title: Improvised drama. No.1
results.brief_description: An inquiry into the value to the English teacher of improvised drama in the classroom. Shows an unrehearsed drama lesson with a class of third year secondary students, and work with a class of fourteen year old boys.
